subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Way/Why
msgSnippet: ... You can avoid local vocabulary, but you can t avoid a local pronunciation. Standard English does not have a standard pronunciation, unlike Standard French
messageBody:
Sid Tanaban scripsit:

> I should think the problem with Read Alphabet is that unless there is
> some kind of explanation of words that are used in a local dialect
> that it would really be burdensome.  Also, instead of going into
> the devil being in details, why not just use an international English
> pronunciation in writing Read's alphabet.  

You can avoid local vocabulary, but you can't avoid a local pronunciation.
Standard English does not have a standard pronunciation, unlike Standard
French or Standard German.

--
John Cowan cowan@...
I amar prestar aen, han mathon ne nen, http://www.ccil.org/~cowan
han mathon ne chae, a han noston ne 'wilith. --Galadriel, LOTR:FOTR
